translated: The former is the vow to be made, and the latter is the vow itself, it should be understood.

original: etānyeva ca mahāpraṇidhānāni pramukhāni kṛtvā tasya bodhisattvasya daśapraṇidhānāsaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇyutpadyante samyak praṇidhānānām /

translated: And having made these very great vows the foremost, that Bodhisattva generates one hundred thousand asaṃkhyeya vows for the perfect vows.

original: tasyaivamāyatyāñca praṇidhānavataḥ dṛṣṭe ca dharme ārabdhavīryasya daśavihārapariśodhanā dharmāḥ pramuditavihārapariśuddhaye saṃvartante /
analyzed: tasya evam āyatyām ca praṇidhānavataḥ dṛṣṭe ca dharme ārabdha vīryasya daśa vihāra pariśodhanāḥ dharmāḥ pramudita vihāra pariśuddhaye saṃvartante
translated: For one who has such aspirations and who has aroused perseverance in this very life, the ten dharmas that purify the ten grounds lead to the purification of the ground of great joy.

original: sarvabuddhadharmānabhiśraddadhāti /🔽pratītyasamutpādayogena kevalaṃ sattvānāṃ duḥkhaskandhasamudāgamaṃ paśyataḥ karuṇā /
analyzed: sarva buddha dharmān abhiśraddadhāti  pratītyasamutpāda yogena kevalam sattvānām duḥkha skandha samudāgamam paśyataḥ karuṇā
translated: One has faith in all the dharmas of the Buddhas.🔽One sees that the mere accumulation of suffering of beings arises through the yoga of dependent origination. Compassion.

original: mayaite sattvā asmātkevalād duḥkhaskandhādvimocayitavyā iti saṃpaśyato maitrī /
analyzed: mayā ete sattvāḥ asmāt kevalāt duḥkha skandhāt vimocayitavyāḥ iti saṃpaśyataḥ maitrī
translated: One sees that I must liberate these beings from this mere accumulation of suffering. Thus, one has loving-kindness.

analyzed: sarva duḥkha paritrāṇa abhiprāyasya ātma nirapekṣa tā  tad nirapekṣasya sattveṣu ādhyātmika bāhya vastu parityāgaḥ
translated: One is indifferent to oneself, intending to rescue from all suffering.🔽One who is indifferent gives up internal and external things for beings.

analyzed: paratas ca teṣām eva sattvānām arthe laukika lokottara dharma parigaveṣaṇaḥ khedaḥ
translated: One is not weary in seeking worldly and transcendent dharmas for the sake of those very beings.

analyzed: akhinnasya ca sarva śāstra jñāna samudāgama viśuddhitaḥ śāstra jña tā
translated: One who is not weary has knowledge of the treatises through the purification of the attainment of all knowledge of the treatises.

analyzed: śāsra jñasya hīna madhya viśiṣṭeṣu sattveṣu yathā yoga anurūpa pratipattitaḥ loka jña tā
translated: One who knows the treatises practices appropriately and suitably among inferior, middling, and superior beings. Thus, one has knowledge of the world.

analyzed: teṣu eva prayogeṣu kāla velā mātra ādi caryām ārabhya hrī vyapatrāpya tā
translated: In those very practices, beginning with the conduct of time, season, measure, etc., there is shame and embarrassment.

analyzed: teṣu eva ca prayogeṣu apratyudāvartana tayā dhṛti bala ādhāna tā
translated: And in those very practices, there is the acquisition of the power of firmness through not turning back.

original: lāmasatkārapratipattibhyāñca tathāgatapūjopasthānatā /🔽ime daśa dharmā vihārapariśuddhaye saṃvartante /🔽yaduta śraddhā karuṇāmaitrītyāgaḥ akhedaḥ śāstrajñatā lokajñatā hrīvyapatrāpyatā dhṛtibalādhānatā tathāgatapūjopasthānatā ca /
analyzed: lāma satkāra pratipattibhyām ca tathāgata pūjā upasthāna tā  ime daśa dharmāḥ vihāra pariśuddhaye saṃvartante  yat uta śraddhā karuṇā maitrī tyāgaḥ akhedaḥ śāstra jña tā loka jña tā hrī vyapatrāpya tā dhṛti bala ādhāna tā tathāgata pūjā upasthāna tā ca
translated: And through the practice of honoring and serving, there is the worship and service of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: dutt
translated: These ten dharmas lead to the purification of the abode, namely: faith, compassion, loving-kindness, generosity, indefatigability, knowledge of the scriptures, knowledge of the world, shame and embarrassment, acquisition of the power of firmness, and worship and service of the Tathāgatas.

original: sa ca bodhisattva etāṃśca dharmāṃ samādāya vartate bahalīkaroti /
analyzed: sa ca bodhisattvaḥ etān ca dharmān samādāya vartate bahalīkaroti
translated: And that bodhisattva, having taken up and practiced those dharmas,

original: tadanyeṣāñca navānāmadhiśīlādīnāṃ bodhisattvavihārāṇāṃ sarvākāramārgaguṇadoṣān paryeṣate buddhabodhisattvānāmantikāt /
analyzed: tad anyeṣām ca navānām adhi śīla ādīnām bodhisattva vihārāṇām sarva ākāra mārga guṇa doṣān paryeṣate buddha bodhisattvānām antikāt
translated: seeks the qualities and faults of the paths of all aspects in the other nine bodhisattva abodes beginning with superior morality, from the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tad abhijñāḥ ca sukha a vipranaṣṭa mārgaḥ su udgṛhīta ākāra pratilambha nisyanda nimittaḥ
translated: And being aware of that, he is on the well-unmistaken path, with the characteristics of the outflow of the attainment of the well-grasped aspects.

analyzed: svayam ca sarva vihārān ākramya mahā bodhim adhigacchati mahāsattva sārtham ca saṃsāra kāntāra mārgāt uttārayati
translated: And having himself ascended all the abodes, he attains great enlightenment. And he delivers the great multitude of beings from the path of the wilderness of samsara.

original: yairākāraiḥ praveśati ta ākārāḥ yaḥ praveśaḥ sa pratilambhaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ ākāraiḥ praveśati te ākārāḥ yaḥ praveśaḥ sa pratilambhaḥ
translated: The aspects by which he enters are the aspects. The entry itself is the attainment.

original: praviṣṭasya yā mahāphalānuśaṃsaniṣpattiḥ samudāgamaśca sa niṣyando veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: praviṣṭasya yā mahā phala anuśaṃsa niṣpattiḥ samudāgamaḥ ca sa nisyandaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: The great fruit and benefit that is accomplished and perfected for one who has entered should be known as the outflow.

original: tasyāsminvihāre vyavasthitasya dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyāṃ bahavo buddhā ābhāsamāgacchanti audārikadarśanasya /
analyzed: tasya asmin vihāre vyavasthitasya dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām bahavaḥ buddhāḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti audārika darśanasya
translated: For one established in this abode, through two causes many Buddhas appear to him, due to his coarse vision.

original: ye ca tena śrutā bhavanti bodhisattvapaṭike /
analyzed: ye ca tena śrutāḥ bhavanti bodhisattva paṭike
translated: And those Bodhisattva scriptures that he has heard,

analyzed: ye ca cetasā dhimuktāḥ bhavanti
translated: and those that he has mentally resolved upon,

original: santi daśasu dikṣu nānānāmasu lokadhātuṣu nānānāmānastathāgatā iti /
analyzed: santi daśasu dikṣu nānā nāmasu lokadhātuṣu nānā nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ iti
translated: There are Tathagatas with various names in various named world systems in the ten directions.

analyzed: tān audārika prasāda sahagatena cetasā darśanāya āyācate
translated: He requests to see them with a mind accompanied by coarse faith.

analyzed: tasya ca tathābhūtasya ṛdhyati eva
translated: And for him, being such, it succeeds.

analyzed: sā āyācanā idam ekam kāraṇam
translated: That request is one cause.

analyzed: evam ca cittam praṇidadhāti
translated: And he makes this resolve:

analyzed: tatra buddha utpādaḥ tatra me janma bhavet iti
translated: May I be born there where a Buddha has appeared.

analyzed: tasya tathābhūtasya ṛdhyati eva tat praṇidhānam
translated: For one who is thus, that vow is successful.

original: sa evamaudārikaprasādadarśanatayā praṇidhānabalādhānatayā ca tāṃstathāgatān dṛṣṭvā sarvākārāṃ pūjāṃ sukhopadhānatāmupasaṃharati yathāśaktyā
analyzed: saḥ evam audārika prasāda darśana tayā praṇidhāna bala ādhāna tayā ca tān tathāgatān dṛṣṭvā sarvākārām pūjām sukha upadhāna tām upasaṃharati yathāśaktyā
translated: Having seen those Tathāgatas through that kind of coarse faith and vision and through the power of the vow, he performs all kinds of worship and provides for their comfort to the best of his ability.

analyzed: yathābalam saṃgha sammānanām ca karoti
translated: He also honors the Saṅgha to the best of his ability.

original: teṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāmantikāddharmaṃ śṛṇoti udgṛhaṇāti dhārayati /
analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām antikāt dharmam śṛṇoti udgṛhaṇāti dhārayati
translated: And from those Tathāgatas he hears the Dharma, receives it, and retains it.

analyzed: dharma anudharma pratipattyā ca sampādayati
translated: And he accomplishes it through the practice of Dharma that accords with the Dharma.

original: tāni ca sarvāṇi kuśalamūlāni mahābodhau pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: tāni ca sarvāṇi kuśala mūlāni mahā bodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: And he dedicates all those roots of goodness to great enlightenment.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca saṃgraha vastubhiḥ sattvān paripācayati
translated: And he ripens beings through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: tasyaibhistribhirviśuddhikāraṇaistāni kuśalamūlāni yad bhūyasyā mātrāyā viśudhyanti
analyzed: tasya ebhiḥ tribhiḥ viśuddhi kāraṇaiḥ tāni kuśala mūlāni yat bhūyasyāḥ mātrāyāḥ viśudhyanti
translated: Through these three causes of purification, those roots of goodness of his become purified to an even greater extent.

analyzed: tathāgata dharma saṃgha pūjā parigrahaṇa tayā saṃgraha vastubhiḥ sattva paripācana tayā
translated: Through the acquisition of worship of the Tathāgata, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and through the ripening of beings through the means of gathering disciples,

analyzed: kuśala mūlānām bodhi pariṇamana tayā ca yāvat anekāni kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: and through the dedication of roots of goodness to enlightenment, for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas.

original: tadyathā suvarṇaṃ prakṛtisthitaṃ yathā yathāgnau prakṣipyate dakṣeṇa karmāreṇa tathā tathā viśuddhataratāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tat yathā suvarṇam prakṛti sthitam yathā yathā agnau prakṣipyate dakṣeṇa karmāreṇa tathā tathā viśuddhatara tām gacchati
translated: Just as gold, when placed in the fire by a skillful smith, becomes purer and purer the more it is worked,

original: evamevāsyāśayaśuddhasya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśalamūlāni taiviṃśuddhikāraṇairviśuddhitaratāṃ gacchanti /🔽tatrasthaścāsāvupapattito yadbhūyasā cakravartī bhavati janmani Dutt
analyzed: evam eva asya āśayaśuddhasya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśala mūlāni taiḥ viṃśuddhi kāraṇaiḥ viśuddhi tara tām gacchanti  tatrasthaḥ ca asau upapattitaḥ yat bhūyasā cakravartī bhavati
translated: in the same way, the roots of good of the bodhisattva whose intention is pure become purer and purer by those causes of purification.

analyzed: janmani jambudvīpa īśvaraḥ
translated: And he, being in that stage, is mostly a universal monarch by rebirth, and in other rebirths a lord of Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: sarva mātsarya mala apagataḥ prabhuḥ sattvānām mātsarya vinayana tāyai
translated: Free from all the stain of stinginess, he is a lord for the purpose of subduing the stinginess of beings.

original: yacca kiñciccaturbhiḥ saṃgrahavastubhiḥ karmārabhyate tatsarvamavirahitaṃ ratnasarvākārabodhisamudāgamamanaskāraiḥ /
analyzed: yat ca kiñcid caturbhiḥ saṃgraha vastubhiḥ karma ārabhyate tat sarvam avirahitam ratna sarva ākāra bodhi samudāgama manaskāraiḥ
translated: And whatever is undertaken by the four means of gathering [disciples], all that is not separated from the recollection of the accumulation of all aspects of enlightenment and jewels.

analyzed: kaścid aham sarva sattvānām agryaḥ sarva artha pratiśaraṇaḥ bhaveyam iti
translated: May I be the foremost of all beings, a refuge for all purposes.

original: ākāṃkṣamāṇaśca tadrūpaṃ vīryamārabhate yatsarvagṛhakalatrabhogānutsṛjya tathāgataśāsane pravrajitvā ekakṣaṇalavamuhūrtena śataṃ bodhisattvasamādhīnāṃ 🔽samāpadyate /
analyzed: ākāṃkṣamāṇaḥ ca tad rūpam vīryam ārabhate yat sarva gṛha kalatra bhogān utsṛjya tathāgata śāsane pravrajitvā eka kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena śatam bodhisattva samādhīnām  samāpadyate
translated: And desiring, he exerts such vigor that, having abandoned all householders, wives, and enjoyments, he goes forth in the teaching of the Tathāgata, and in one moment, in one instant, he enters a hundred bodhisattva concentrations.

analyzed: tathāgata śatam nānā buddhakṣetreṣu divyena cakṣuṣā paśyati
translated: He sees with his divine eye a hundred Tathāgatas in various buddha-fields.

analyzed: teṣām ca nirmita adhiṣṭhānam bodhisattva adhiṣṭhān ca jānāti
translated: And he knows their emanations and consecrations, and the consecrations of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: lokadhātu śatam ca kampayati
translated: He shakes a hundred world systems.

analyzed: tathā kāyena ākrāmate
translated: And he goes there with his body.

analyzed: ābhayā spharitvā pareṣām upadarśayati
translated: Having pervaded with his radiance, he shows it to others.

analyzed: vineya sattva śatam nirmita śatena paripācayati
translated: He ripens a hundred beings to be trained with a hundred emanations.

analyzed: kalpa śatam api ākāṃkṣamāṇaḥ sthānam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Desiring, he remains for a hundred eons.

analyzed: kalpa śatam ca pūrva anta apara antataḥ jñāna darśanena praviśati
translated: And for a hundred eons, he enters with the knowledge and vision of the past and future.

analyzed: dharma mukha śatam ca pravicinoti skandha dhātu āyatana ādikānām dharma mukhānām
translated: And he analyzes a hundred Dharma doors, such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

analyzed: kāya śatam ca nirmimīte
translated: And he emanates a hundred bodies.

original: kāyañca kāyaṃ bodhisattvaśataparivāramādarśayati ataḥparaṃ praṇidhānabalenāpramāṇā prabhāvavikurvaṇā bodhisattvānāṃ veditavyā asmin pramuditavihāre
analyzed: kāyam ca kāyam bodhisattva śata parivāram ādarśayati atas param praṇidhāna balena apramāṇā prabhāva vikurvaṇā bodhisattvānām veditavyā asmin pramudita vihāre
translated: He displays a body and a body with a retinue of hundreds of bodhisattvas. Beyond this, the immeasurable magical transformations of the bodhisattvas should be known through the power of vows in this stage of great joy.

analyzed: sthitānām
translated: For those abiding in this stage of great joy,

analyzed: praṇidhāna balikāḥ hi te praṇidhāna viśeṣaiḥ vikurvanti
translated: for they who possess the power of vows transform through the distinctions of their vows.

original: teṣāṃ samyak praṇidhānāṃ na sukarāṃ saṃkhyā kartu yāvatkalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrairapi /
analyzed: teṣām samyak praṇidhānām na sukarām saṃkhyā kartu yāvat kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ api
translated: It is not easy to count their correct vows, even in hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas.

original: evamayaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ pramuditavihāraḥ suviniścitataḥ caturākāraḥ cittotpādataḥ
analyzed: evam ayam bodhisattvānām pramudita vihāraḥ su viniścitataḥ catur ākāraḥ citta utpādataḥ
translated: Thus, this stage of great joy of the bodhisattvas is to be known as having four aspects: well-determined, the generation of the mind,

analyzed: samyak praṇidhāna vīrya ārambha abhinirhārataḥ vihāra pariśodhanataḥ tad anya vihāra vyutpattitaḥ
translated: the accomplishment of the correct vows, the exertion of effort, and the purification of the stage, the understanding of the other stages,

analyzed: kuśala mūla pariśodhanataḥ upapattitaḥ prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: the purification of the roots of goodness, rebirth, and power, in brief.

analyzed: vistara nirdeśataḥ punar yathāsūtram eva daśa bhūmike pramudita bhūmi nirdeśam ārabhya
translated: But in detail, it should be known as beginning with the teaching on the stage of great joy in the Daśabhūmika Sūtra, just as in the sūtra.

original: yāśca daśabhūmike sūtre daśa bodhisattvabhūmayaḥ ta iha bodhisattvapiṭake mātṛkānirdeśadaśabodhisattvavihārā yathākramaṃ pramuditavihāramupādāya
analyzed: yāḥ ca daśa bhūmike sūtre daśa bodhisattva bhūmayaḥ te iha bodhisattva piṭake mātṛkā nirdeśa daśa bodhisattva vihārāḥ yathākramam pramudita vihāram upādāya
translated: And the ten bodhisattva stages in the Dashabhumika Sutra are to be known here in the Bodhisattva Canon as the ten bodhisattva abodes taught in the Matrka, beginning with the abode of great joy

analyzed: yāvat parama vihārāt veditavyāḥ
translated: up to the supreme abode.

analyzed: tatra bodhisattvānām parigraha arthena bhūmiḥ iti ucyate
translated: There, the stages of the bodhisattvas are called stages in the sense of being taken up.

analyzed: upabhoga vāsa arthena punar vihāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: And they are called abodes in the sense of being the place of enjoyment.

original: tatra katame bodhisattvānāmadhiśīlavihārasya ākārāḥ kāni liṅgāni kāni nimittani veditavyāni /
analyzed: tatra katame bodhisattvānām adhi śīla vihārasya ākārāḥ kāni liṅgāni kāni veditavyāni
translated: Herein, what are the aspects, what are the signs, what are the indications of the bodhisattvas' abode of superior morality?

original: iha bodhisattvena pūrvameva pramuditavihāre daśākāreṇa Dutt
analyzed: iha bodhisattvena pūrvam eva pramudita vihāre daśa ākāreṇa
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, by the tenfold pure intention

analyzed: citta āśayena āśaya śuddhiḥ pratilabdhā bhavati
translated: with regard to the Dharma, attains the purity of intention in the stage of great joy.

analyzed: sarva ācārya guru dakṣiṇīya a visaṃvādana adhyāśayaḥ
translated: The superior intention not to deceive any teacher, guru, or person worthy of respect.

analyzed: saha dhārmika bodhisattva sauratya sukha saṃvāsa āśayaḥ
translated: The superior intention to dwell happily in harmony with fellow Buddhists and bodhisattvas.
The superior intention to overcome all afflictions, secondary afflictions, and the actions of Mara, and to be in control of one's own mind.

analyzed: sarva saṃskāreṣu doṣa āśayaḥ nirvāṇe nuśaṃsa āśayaḥ
translated: The superior intention to see the faults in all conditioned things and the benefits in nirvana.

analyzed: kuśalānām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām bhāvanā sātatya āśayaḥ
translated: The intention of constantly cultivating the wholesome factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: teṣām eva ca bhāvanā anukūla tayā prāvivikya āśayaḥ  sarva laukā āmiṣa samucchraya lābha satkāra nirapekṣa āśayaḥ
translated: And the intention of seclusion, because it is favorable to the cultivation of those very [wholesome factors].🔽The intention of being independent of all worldly gain, honor, and respect.

analyzed: hīnayānam apahāya mahāyāna adhigama āśayaḥ sarva sattva sarva artha karaṇa āśayaḥ ca
translated: The intention of abandoning the Lesser Vehicle and attaining the Great Vehicle, and the intention of accomplishing all the aims of all beings.

analyzed: iti ime daśa samyak āśayāḥ tasmin citte pravṛttāḥ bhavanti
translated: Thus, these ten right intentions occur in that thought.

analyzed: yaiḥ asya āśayaḥ śuddhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: By them, his intention is said to be pure.

analyzed: eṣām eva ca āśayānām adhimātra tvāt paripūrṇa tvāt dvitīyam adhi śīlavihāram bodhisattvaḥ praviśati ākramate
translated: And by the greatness and fullness of these very intentions, the bodhisattva enters, i.e., attains, the second stage of superior morality.

analyzed: saḥ dhi śīla vihāre prakṛti śīlī bhavati
translated: In that stage of superior morality, he becomes naturally moral.

analyzed: su alpam api mithyā karma patha saṃgṛhīta dauḥśīlyam na samudācarati
translated: He does not engage in even a little immorality included in the wrong paths of action,

analyzed: prāk eva madhyam adhimātram vā
translated: let alone a medium or great [amount].

original: daśasu ca paripūrṇeṣu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu prakṛtyā saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: daśasu ca paripūrṇeṣu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu prakṛtyā saṃdṛśyate
translated: And he is seen to be naturally engaged in the ten completely wholesome courses of action.

original: sa evaṃ prakṛtiśīlī prajñayā kliṣṭākliṣṭānāṃ karmapathānāṃ durgatisugatiyāneṣu karmasamudācāre hetuphalasamudāgamavyavasthānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ
analyzed: saḥ evam prakṛti śīlī prajñayā kliṣṭa akliṣṭānām karma pathānām durgati sugati yāneṣu karma samudācāre hetu phala samudāgama vyavasthānam yathābhūtam
translated: Thus, one who has this natural morality, by means of wisdom, knows as it truly is the establishment of the cause and result of the performance of actions that are defiled or undefiled, that lead to bad destinies or good destinies.

analyzed: vipāka nisyanda phalataḥ ca tāni karmāṇi yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: And one knows as it truly is those actions in terms of the result of evolutionary development and the result of natural outcome.

original: sa svayaṃ cākuśalakarmaprahāṇe kuśalakarmasamādāne saṃdṛśyate /🔽parāṃśca tatraiva samādāpayitukāmo bhavati samādāpayati ca viṣamakarmasamācāradoṣaduṣṭañca🔽sattvadhātuṃ sarvamaviśeṣeṇa sampattivipattigataṃ paramārthato duḥkhitaṃ vyasanasthaṃ
analyzed: sa svayam ca akuśala karma prahāṇe kuśala karma samādāne saṃdṛśyate  parān ca tatra eva samādāpayitu kāmaḥ bhavati samādāpayati ca viṣama karma samācāra doṣa duṣṭam ca  sattvadhātum sarvam aviśeṣeṇa sampatti vipatti gatam paramārthataḥ duḥkhitam vyasana stham
translated: One is seen oneself to abandon unwholesome actions and take up wholesome actions.🔽One wishes to cause others to do the same, and one does cause them to do so. One looks upon the realm of sentient beings, which is afflicted by the fault of engaging in unwholesome actions, without distinction as to whether they are in a fortunate realm or an unfortunate realm, as being in a state of suffering in the ultimate sense.

analyzed: vicitraiḥ vyasana ākāraiḥ anukampamānaḥ nukampā vaipulyam anuprāptaḥ pratyavekṣate
translated: With great compassion, one looks upon the realm of sentient beings with great compassion, which is filled with various forms of misfortune.

original: tasyāsmin adhiśīlavihāre vyavasthitasya buddhadarśanaṃ kuśalamūlaviśuddhiḥ pūrvavadveditavyā /
analyzed: tasya asmin adhi śīla vihāre vyavasthitasya buddha darśanam kuśala mūla viśuddhiḥ pūrvavat veditavyā
translated: For one who is established in this pleasurable state of superior morality, the vision of the buddhas and the purification of roots of virtue should be understood as described previously.

analyzed: tatra ayam viśeṣaḥ
translated: However, there is this difference.

original: tadyathā tadeva suvarṇaṃ kuśalena karmakāreṇa kāsīsaṃ grakṣiptaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā viśuddhataraṃ bhavatyagnau prakṣipyamāṇam /
analyzed: tat yathā tat eva suvarṇam kuśalena karmakāreṇa kāsīsam grakṣiptam bhūyasyā mātrayā viśuddhataram bhavati agnau prakṣipyamāṇam
translated: For example, that same gold, when put into vitriol by a skillful smith, becomes much more pure when put into the fire.

analyzed: evam asya bodhisattvasya sā kuśala mūla viśuddhiḥ veditavyā
translated: Thus should be understood the purification of that bodhisattva's wholesome roots.

analyzed: asmin ca vihāre śuddha citta āśaya niṣpatti praveśataḥ upapattitaḥ cāturdvīpakaḥ cakravartī bhavati
translated: And in this abode, by the attainment of a pure mind and intention, and by rebirth, he becomes a universal monarch of the four continents.

original: yadbhūyasā bāhulyena ca dauḥśīlyādakuśalebhyaḥ karmapathebhyaḥ sattvān vyāvartayati /
analyzed: yat bhūyasā bāhulyena ca dauḥśīlyāt akuśalebhyaḥ karma pathebhyaḥ sattvān vyāvartayati
translated: For the most part, he turns beings away from immorality and unwholesome courses of action,

analyzed: kuśaleṣu ca karma patheṣu samādāpayati
translated: and he encourages them in wholesome courses of action.

analyzed: prabhāvaḥ pi asya pūrvakāt daśaguṇaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: And his power should be understood as ten times greater than before.

analyzed: iti evam bodhisattvānām adhi śīla vihāraḥ
translated: Thus is the bodhisattvas' abode of superior morality.

analyzed: prakṛti śīlataḥ ca sarva ākāra dauḥśīlya mala apakarṣataḥ ca sarva karma patha sarva ākāra hetu phala jñāna prativedhataḥ ca
translated: By natural morality, by removing the stains of all kinds of immorality, by penetrating the knowledge of the causes and results of all courses of action,

analyzed: śubhe karmaṇī para samādāpana kāmaḥ ca anukampā vaipulya pratilambhataḥ ca
translated: by being desirous of encouraging others in wholesome actions, and by attaining the abundance of compassion, he becomes one who has attained the abode of superior morality.

analyzed: sattvadhātu karma ja duḥkha vyasana ālocanataḥ ca kuśala mūla viśuddhitaḥ ca upapattitaḥ ca prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: It should be known in brief by the consideration of the suffering and misfortune born of the karma of the realm of sentient beings, by the purification of the roots of good, by rebirth, and by power.

original: vistaranirdeśataḥ punaryathā sūtrameva yathā daśabhūmike vimalāyāṃ bhūmau dauḥśīlyamalāpagatatvāt vimalā bhūmirityucyate /
analyzed: vistara nirdeśataḥ punar yathā sūtram eva yathā daśa bhūmike vimalāyām bhūmau dauḥśīlya mala apagata tvāt vimalā bhūmiḥ iti ucyate
translated: But the detailed explanation is just as in the sutra itself, as in the Dashabhumika, in the Vimalā bhūmi, it is called Vimalā because it is free from the stain of immorality.

analyzed: dauḥśīlya mala apagata tvāt eva adhi śīla vihāraḥ iti
translated: And because it is free from the stain of immorality, it is called the abode of superior morality.

original: yā tatra vimalā bhūmiḥ sehādhiśīlavihāro veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: yā tatra vimalā bhūmiḥ sā iha ādhi śīla vihāraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: That Vimalā bhūmi there should be known as the abode of superior morality here.

original: tatra katame bodhisattvānāmākārāḥ kāni liṅgāni kāni nimittāni adhicittavihārasya /
analyzed: tatra katame bodhisattvānām ākārāḥ kāni liṅgāni kāni nimittāni adhicittavihārasya
translated: What are the aspects, what are the signs, what are the indications of the abode of superior mind for the bodhisattvas there?

original: iha bodhisattvena pūrvamevādhiśīlavihāre te daśa śuddhāśayā manasikṛtā bhavanti juṣṭāḥ pratividdhāḥ /
analyzed: iha bodhisattvena pūrvam eva adhi śīla vihāre te daśa śuddha āśayāḥ manasi kṛtāḥ bhavanti juṣṭāḥ pratividdhāḥ
translated: Here, the bodhisattva has already mentally attended to those ten pure intentions in the abode of superior morality, has enjoyed them, and has penetrated them.

analyzed: daśabhiḥ aparaiḥ ākāraiḥ teṣām citta āśaya manasikārāṇām adhimātra tvāt paripūrṇa tvāt adhi śīla vihāram samatikramya adhi citta vihāram anupraviśati
translated: By means of ten other aspects, because those mental intentions and attitudes are superior and complete, he transcends the abode of superior morality and enters the abode of superior mind.

analyzed: śuddhaḥ me daśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ citta āśayaḥ iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “My mind and intention are pure in ten ways,” by this mental attention.

analyzed: abhavyaḥ ca aham tasmāt daśa ākārāt śuddha āśayāt parihāṇāya iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “I am incapable of falling away from that pure intention in ten ways,” by this mental attention.

original: sarvāsravasāsraveṣu me dharmeṣu cittaṃ na praskandati pratikūlatāyāṃ ca santiṣṭhata iti manasikāreṇa /
analyzed: sarva āsrava sa āsraveṣu me dharmeṣu cittam na praskandati pratikūla tāyām ca santiṣṭhate iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “My mind does not rush out to any dharmas that are accompanied by any of the outflows, and it does not stand in opposition to them,” by this mental attention.

original: tatpratipakṣabhāvanāyāṃ ca me vijñānaṃ saṃsthitamiti manasikāreṇa /
analyzed: tad pratipakṣa bhāvanāyām ca me vijñānam saṃsthitam iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “My consciousness is established in the cultivation of the counteragent to them,” by this mental attention.

analyzed: abhavyaḥ ca aham asmāt pratipakṣāt punar parihāṇāya iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “I am incapable of falling away again from that counteragent,” by this mental attention.

analyzed: abhavyaḥ ca aham evam dṛḍha pratipakṣaḥ taiḥ sarva āsrava sa āsravaiḥ dharmaiḥ sarva māraiḥ ca abhibhavitum iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “I am incapable of being overcome by any of the dharmas that are accompanied by any of the outflows, or by any of the māras, because of that firm counteragent,” by this mental attention.

original: asaṃlīnaṃ ca me mānasaṃ pravartate sarvabuddhadharmeṣviti manasikāreṇa /
analyzed: asaṃlīnam ca me mānasam pravartate sarva buddha dharmeṣu iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “My mind proceeds without depression with regard to all the qualities of the Buddhas,” by this mental attention.

original: sarvaduṣkaracaryāsu ca me nāsti vyatheti manasikāreṇa /
analyzed: sarva duṣkara caryāsu ca me nā asti vyathā iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “I do not feel any pain in any of the difficult courses of action,” by this mental attention.

original: adhimuktaṃ ca me mahāyāne cittamekāntena na tadanyahīnayāneṣviti manasikāreṇa /
analyzed: adhimuktam ca me mahāyāne cittam ekāntena na tad anya hīna yāneṣu iti manasikāreṇa
translated: “My mind is exclusively devoted to the Great Vehicle, and not to the other vehicles that are inferior,” by this mental attention.

analyzed: sarva sattva artha kriyā abhiratam ca me cittam iti manasikāreṇa
translated: And with the mental attention that thinks, “My mind is devoted to acting for the benefit of all sentient beings.”

analyzed: ebhiḥ daśabhiḥ citta āśaya manasikāraiḥ praviśati
translated: He enters with these ten mental attentions of aspiration.

analyzed: adhicittavihāra sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva saṃskārān ādīnava ākāraiḥ vicitraiḥ vidūṣayati
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the superior pleasurable state of superior mind, having seen the various disadvantages of all conditioned things, becomes disgusted with them.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca mānasam udvejayati
translated: And he becomes terrified of them.

analyzed: buddha jñāne ca anuśaṃsa darśī bhavati vicitraiḥ anuśaṃsa ākāraiḥ
translated: And he sees the benefits of the Buddha’s knowledge with various views of benefits.

original: tatra ca spṛhājāto bhavati ghanarasena cchandena /
analyzed: tatra ca spṛhā jātaḥ bhavati ghana rasena chandena
translated: And he becomes one who is born of longing for that with a very thick desire.

analyzed: sattvadhātum duḥkhitam vyavalokayati vicitraiḥ duḥkha ākāraiḥ
translated: He looks at the realm of sentient beings who are suffering with various views of suffering.

analyzed: teṣu ca sattveṣu upekṣā cittaḥ bhavati artha pratiśaraṇa cittaḥ
translated: And he becomes one who has a mind of equanimity toward those sentient beings, a mind that is a refuge for their benefit.

analyzed: sarva saṃskāreṣu apramattaḥ
translated: He is heedful with regard to all conditioned things.

analyzed: bodhāya uttapta vīryaḥ
translated: He is one whose effort is heated up for enlightenment.

analyzed: sattveṣu vipula karuṇā āśayaḥ
translated: He is one whose attitude of compassion toward sentient beings is vast.

analyzed: teṣām sattvānām atyanta duḥkha vimokṣa upāyam sarva kleśa anāvaraṇa jñānam eva paśyati
translated: He sees that the method for completely liberating those sentient beings from suffering is nothing other than the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the afflictions.

original: Dutt tasya ca vimokṣasya samudāgamāya dharmadhātau sarvavikalpapracārasaṃlkeśotpattipratipakṣaṃ prajñāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: tasya ca vimokṣasya samudāgamāya dharmadhātau sarva vikalpa pracāra saṃl keśa utpatti pratipakṣam prajñām paśyati
translated: And for the realization of that liberation, he sees wisdom in the dharma-realm as the antidote to the arising of all conceptual proliferation.

original: tasya ca jñānālokasya niṣpattaye samyaksaṃbodhiṃ paśyati /
analyzed: tasya ca jñāna ālokasya niṣpattaye samyaksaṃbodhim paśyati
translated: And for the accomplishment of that light of knowledge, he sees perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat ca dhyāna samādhi samāpatti nirhāram bodhisattva piṭaka śravaṇa pūrvakam śravaṇa nidānam paśyati
translated: And that accomplishment of meditation, concentration, and attainment, he sees as preceded by listening to the Bodhisattva Canon, with listening as its basis.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca mahatā vīrya ārambheṇa śruta paryeṣṭim āpadyate
translated: And having seen that, with great exertion of effort, he engages in the pursuit of learning.

original: saddharmaśravaṇahetornāsti taddraviṇaṃ pariṣkāramādhyātmikavāhyaṃ vastu yanna parityajati /
analyzed: saddharma śravaṇa hetoḥ na asti tat draviṇam pariṣkāram ādhyātmika vāhyam vastu yat na parityajati
translated: For the sake of listening to the true Dharma, there is no wealth, no possessions, no inner or outer thing that he does not give up.

analyzed: na asti sā guru paricaryā yān na abhyupagacchati
translated: There is no service to teachers that he does not accept.

analyzed: na asti sā santatiḥ yān na abhyupagacchati
translated: There is no continuity that he does not accept.

analyzed: na asti sā kāya utpīḍā yān na abhyupagacchati
translated: There is no bodily affliction that he does not accept.

original: sa prītataro bhavatyeka catuṣpadagāthāśravaṇena na tvevaṃ trisāhasrapūrṇapratimena mahāratnarāśinā /
analyzed: sa prītataraḥ bhavati eka catuṣpada gāthā śravaṇena na tu evam tri sāhasra pūrṇa pratimena mahā ratna rāśinā
translated: He is more delighted by hearing a single four-line verse than by a great heap of jewels equal to the three-thousandfold world system.

analyzed: prītataraḥ bhavati eka dharma pada śravaṇena samyaksaṃbuddha upanītena bodhisattva caryā pariśodhakena
translated: He is even more pleased by hearing a single phrase of the Dharma taught by the Perfectly Awakened One, which purifies the conduct of a bodhisattva,

analyzed: na sarva śakra tva māra tva brahma tva lokapāla tva cakravarti tva samucchraya pratilambhaiḥ
translated: than by attaining the status of Śakra, Māra, Brahmā, a world guardian, or a wheel-turning king.

analyzed: sa ced enam kaścid evam vadet
translated: If someone were to say to him:

analyzed: evam aham idam dharma padam samyaksaṃbuddha upanītam sarva bodhisattva caryā pariśodhakam
translated: I will teach you this phrase of the Dharma taught by the Perfectly Awakened One, which purifies all the conduct of a bodhisattva,

original: te 'nuśrāvayiṣyāmi sa cenmahatyāmagnikhadāyāmātmānaṃ prakṣipasi mahāntañca duḥkhopakramaṃ saṃpratīcchasīti /
analyzed: te nuśrāvayiṣyāmi sa ced mahatyām agni khadāyām ātmānam prakṣipasi mahāntam ca duḥkha upakramam saṃpratīcchasi iti
translated: if you throw yourself into a great pit of fire and endure great suffering.

analyzed: śrutvā asya evam bhavet
translated: Having heard this, he would think:

original: utsahāmyahamasya dharmapadasyārthe pūrvavat trisāhasramahāsāhasrapratimāyāmāpyagnikhadāyāṃ brahmalokādātmānamutsraṣṭuṃ prāgeva pratyavarāyām
analyzed: utsahāmi aham asya dharma padasya arthe pūrvavat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra pratimāyām āpya agni khadāyām brahma lokāt ātmānam utsraṣṭum prāk eva pratyavarāyām
translated: For the sake of this phrase of the Dharma, I would have the courage to throw myself from the Brahma world into a pit of fire the size of the great trichiliocosm, as before, let alone into a small one.

analyzed: nāraka duḥkha saṃvāsaiḥ api asmābhiḥ buddha dharmāḥ paryeṣitavyāḥ prāk eva prākṛtaiḥ duḥkha upakramaiḥ iti
translated: For the sake of the Buddha's teachings, we should seek them even by enduring the sufferings of hell, let alone by ordinary hardships.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa vīryārambheṇa dharmān paryeṣyaivaṃ yoniśo manasikaroti /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa vīrya ārambheṇa dharmān paryeṣya evam yoniśas manasikaroti
translated: Having sought the Dharma with such an exertion of effort, he thus properly attends to it.

analyzed: yathā dharma annu dharma pratipattim buddha dharma anugatām na vyañjana svara mātra viśaddhim iti
translated: Knowing that the practice of the Dharma is in accordance with the Buddha's teachings, not just in the clarity of mere words and sounds,

original: viditvā tadeva śrutaṃ niśritya dharmanimittāni samyagālambanīkurvan viviktaṃ kāmairvistareṇa
analyzed: viditvā tat eva śrutam niśritya dharma nimittāni samyak ālambanīkurvan viviktam kāmaiḥ vistareṇa
translated: having relied on that very learning, properly taking the signs of the Dharma as the object, he abides in seclusion, free from desires,

original: prathamaṃ dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ caturthañca dhyānaṃ laukikaṃ catasra ārūpyasamāpattīrlaukikīścatvāryapramāṇāni
analyzed: prathamam dvitīyam tṛtīyam caturtham ca dhyānam laukikam catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ laukikīḥ catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: in detail, he attains and abides in the first, second, third, and fourth worldly concentrations, the four formless attainments, the worldly four immeasurables,

original: pañca cābhijñā upasaṃpadya viharati /🔽sa tairbahulaṃ vihṛtya tāni dhyānāni samādhīn samāpattīḥ vyāvartayitvā praṇidhānavaśena kāmadhātau yatra sattvārthaṃ bodhipakṣadharmaparipūriṃ
analyzed: pañca ca abhijñāḥ upasaṃpadya viharati  sa taiḥ bahulam vihṛtya tāni dhyānāni samādhīn samāpattīḥ vyāvartayitvā praṇidhāna vaśena kāmadhātau yatra sattva artham bodhi pakṣa dharma paripūrim
translated: and the five superknowledges.

analyzed: ca paśyati tatra upapadyate
translated: Having dwelt in them extensively, turning away from those concentrations, meditative absorptions, and attainments, by the power of his vow, he is reborn wherever he sees the fulfillment of the factors of enlightenment and the benefit of beings in the desire realm.

analyzed: na tu eva asya tad vaśena upapattiḥ bhavati
translated: But he is not reborn under their power.

original: tasya kāmavītarāgatvātkāmabandhanāni prahīṇāni bhavanti dhyānasamādhisamāpattivyāvartanatvād Dutt
analyzed: tasya kāma vīta rāga tvāt kāma bandhanāni prahīṇāni bhavanti dhyāna samādhi samāpatti vyāvartana tvāt
translated: Because he is free from desire for the desire realm, the bonds of desire are abandoned for him. Because he turns away from the concentrations, meditative absorptions, and attainments, the bonds of existence are abandoned.

analyzed: bhava bandhanāni
translated: The bonds of existence.

original: adhimukticaryābhūmāvevāsya pūrvameva dharmatathatādhimokṣād dṛṣṭikṛtabandhanāni prahīṇāni bhavanti /
analyzed: adhimukti caryā bhūmau eva asya pūrvam eva dharma tathatā adhimokṣāt dṛṣṭi kṛta bandhanāni prahīṇāni bhavanti
translated: On the stage of conduct through devoted interest itself, his bonds of views are already abandoned due to his devoted interest in the suchness of dharmas.

analyzed: mithyā rāga dveṣa mohāḥ ca asya atyantam na pravartante
translated: And his false attachment, hatred, and delusion do not operate at all.

analyzed: tasya buddha darśanam vistareṇa kuśala mūla viśuddhiḥ pūrvavat veditavyā
translated: His seeing of the Buddhas and the purification of the roots of good should be understood in detail as before.

analyzed: tatra ayam viśeṣaḥ
translated: But there is this difference.

original: tadyathā tadeva suvarṇakuśalasya karmārasya hastagataṃ prakṣīṇamalakaṣāyamapi samadharaṇamavatiṣṭhate tulyamānam /
analyzed: tat yathā tat eva suvarṇa kuśalasya karmārasya hasta gatam prakṣīṇam ala kaṣāyam api sama dharaṇam avatiṣṭhate tulya mānam
translated: Just as that same gold in the hands of a skillful goldsmith, though its stains and impurities are removed, remains on an even surface when weighed,

analyzed: evam asya sā kuśala mūla viśuddhiḥ veditavyā
translated: so his purification of the roots of good should be understood.

analyzed: upapattitaḥ ca śakraḥ bhavati deva indraḥ yat bhūyasā
translated: And by rebirth he becomes Śakra, lord of the gods, for the most part.

analyzed: kuśalaḥ sattvānām kāma rāga vinivartana tāyai
translated: He is skilled in turning beings away from attachment to desire.

original: prabhāve 'pi yatra pūrvake vihāre sahasramākhyātaṃ tatreha śatasahasraṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: prabhāve pi yatra pūrvake vihāre sahasram ākhyātam tatra iha śata sahasram veditavyam
translated: And in power, where a thousand was mentioned in the previous stage, here a hundred thousand should be understood.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvānām adhi cittavihāraḥ citta manaskāra pariniṣpatti praveśataḥ ca saṃsāra sattvadhātu mahā bodhi samyak prativedhataḥ ca
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' abode of superior mind, because it is the entry into the perfection of mind and mental activity, and because of the correct penetration of the great enlightenment of the world and the realm of beings.

analyzed: sattva duḥkha vimokṣa upāya samyak paryeṣaṇataḥ ca mahā gaurava dharma paryeṣaṇataḥ ca dharma anudharma pratipatti laukika dhyāna samādhi samāpatti abhijñā abhinirhāra vihārataḥ ca
translated: It is the correct search for the means of liberation from the suffering of beings, the search for the Dharma with great respect, and the abode of the accomplishment of the worldly meditations, concentrations, attainments, and superknowledges.

analyzed: tad vyāvartanam praṇidhāya yatra kāma upapattitaḥ ca kuśala mūla viśuddhitaḥ ca upapattitaḥ ca
translated: It is the turning away from that, the rebirth wherever one wishes, the purification of the roots of goodness, the rebirth,

analyzed: prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: and the power. It should be known as taught in brief.

original: vistaranirdeśaḥ punaryathāsūtraṃ tadyathā daśabhūmike prabhākaryāṃ bhūmau /
analyzed: vistara nirdeśaḥ punar yathāsūtram tat yathā daśa bhūmike prabhākaryām bhūmau
translated: The extensive explanation is as in the sutra, such as in the Dashabhumika on the ground of Radiant Light.

analyzed: śruta ākāra dharma āloka avabhāsa samādhi āloka avabhāsa prabhāvita tvāt asyāḥ bhūmeḥ prabhākarī iti ucyate
translated: Because this ground is manifested by the light of concentration of the light of the Dharma of the aspect of hearing, it is called Radiant Light.

original: adhyātmaṃ cittaviśuddhimupādāya sā prabhā saṃbhavati tasmātsa vihāraḥ adhicitta ityucyate /
analyzed: adhyātmam citta viśuddhim upādāya sā prabhā saṃbhavati tasmāt sa vihāraḥ adhicittaḥ iti ucyate
translated: That light arises based on the purity of mind within, therefore that abode is called superior mind.

analyzed: yena arthena prabhākarī bhūmiḥ tena eva arthena adhicittavihāraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: The stage of Radiance should be understood as having the same meaning as the abode of the mind.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ bodhisattvānām bodhi pakṣya pratisaṃyuktaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: Herein, what is the bodhisattvas' abode of superior wisdom associated with the factors of enlightenment?

original: iha bodhisattvena pūrvamevādhicittavihāre daśa dharmālokapraveśāḥ śrutaparyeṣṭimadhipattiṃ kṛtvā pratilabdhā bhavanti /
analyzed: iha bodhisattvena pūrvam eva adhicittavihāre daśa dharmāloka praveśāḥ śruta paryeṣṭim adhipattim kṛtvā pratilabdhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Here, the bodhisattva has already attained the ten entrances to the light of the Dharma in the previous abode of superior mind, having made the search for learning the basis.

analyzed: yeṣām adhimātra tvāt paripūrṇa tvāt adhicittavihāram atikramya prathamam adhiprajñavihāram praviśati
translated: By their intensity and completeness, he transcends the abode of superior mind and enters the first abode of superior wisdom.

original: te punardaśa dharmālokapraveśā granthato yathā sūtrameva veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: te punar daśa dharma āloka praveśāḥ granthataḥ yathā sūtram eva veditavyaḥ
translated: Those ten entrances to the light of the Dharma should be known from the scriptures just as in the sutra.

original: ye ca prajñapyante yatra ca prajñapyante yena ca prajñapyante te ca yatsamāḥ paramārthaḥ🔽yasya ca saṃkleśavyavadānaśca saṃkliśyante viśuddhante ca yatpratiyusaṃktena saṃkleśena
analyzed: ye ca prajñapyante yatra ca prajñapyante yena ca prajñapyante te ca yad samāḥ paramārthaḥ  yasya ca saṃkleśa vyavadānaḥ ca saṃkliśyante ca yat saṃkleśena
translated: And those that are designated, where they are designated, and by what they are designated, they are the same in ultimate reality.

analyzed: saṃkliśyante yayā ca anuttarayā viśuddhyā 🔽viśudhyante
translated: And those that are defiled and purified, and by what defilement and purification they are defiled and purified, and by what unsurpassed purity they are purified.

analyzed: iti ayam samāsa arthaḥ teṣām dharma āloka nirdeśānām veditavyaḥ
translated: This should be understood as the summarized meaning of those teachings on the illumination of the Dharma.

analyzed: sa tasmin vihāre vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He, established in that abode,

original: abhedyāśayatā pūrvaṅgamairyathāsūtrameva daśākāreṇa jñānaparipākena jñānaparipācakairdharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ saṃvṛtto bhavati tathāgatakule
analyzed: abhedya āśaya tā pūrvaṅgamaiḥ yathāsūtram eva daśa ākāreṇa jñāna paripākena jñāna paripācakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ saṃvṛttaḥ bhavati tathāgata kule
translated: is endowed with the ten kinds of maturation of knowledge, which are the dharmas that bring about the maturation of knowledge, preceded by the unshakable resolve, as stated in the sutra. He becomes one who has attained the nature of the Tathāgata family

analyzed: tad ātmaka dharma pratilambhāt
translated: because he has attained the dharmas that are of that nature.

original: sarvākārāṃ bodhisattvāpekṣāmadhipatiṃ kṛtvā smṛtyupasthānapramukhān saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyān dharmān bhāvayanti yathāsūtrameva /
analyzed: sarvākārām bodhisattva apekṣām adhipatim kṛtvā smṛti upasthāna pramukhān saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyān dharmān bhāvayanti yathāsūtram eva
translated: Having made the bodhisattva's aspiration in all its aspects the dominant condition, he cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment beginning with the establishments of mindfulness, exactly as stated in the sutra.

original: tasya tāndharmānupāyaparigraheṇa bhāvayataḥ satkāyadṛṣṭiḥ susūkṣmāpyasya skandhadhātvāyatanānyabhiniveśaḥ sarveñjitāni cātyantāsamudācārataḥ
analyzed: tasya tān dharmān upāya parigraheṇa bhāvayataḥ satkāyadṛṣṭiḥ su sūkṣmā api asya skandha dhātu āyatanāni abhiniveśaḥ sarva iñjitāni ca atyanta asamudācārataḥ  /
translated: For him, as he cultivates those dharmas with the support of skillful means, even the most subtle view of a real self, his attachment to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and all the movements of mind are completely abandoned.

analyzed: prahīyante
translated: They are abandoned.

original: teṣāṃ prahāṇād yāni tathāgatavivarṇitāni karmāṇi tāni sarveṇa sarvaṃ nādhyācarati /
analyzed: teṣām prahāṇāt yāni tathāgata vivarṇitāni karmāṇi tāni sarveṇa sarvam na adhyācarati
translated: Because of their abandonment, he completely and totally does not engage in those actions that are disapproved of by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: yāni punar tathāgata varṇitāni tāni sarvā api anuvartante yathāvat
translated: And he completely engages in those that are approved of by the Tathāgata, as they are.

original: tathābhūtaśca bhūyasā mātrayā snigdhamṛdukarmaṇyacittaśca bhavati tathā citrākārasuviśuddhacittaśca /
analyzed: tathābhūtaḥ ca bhūyasā mātrayā snigdha mṛdu karmaṇi acittaḥ ca bhavati tathā citra ākāra su viśuddha cittaḥ ca
translated: And being such, he becomes even more so, with a mind that is more and more pliant, workable, and soft, and with a mind that is well-purified in various ways.

analyzed: kṛtajña kṛta vedita ādibhiḥ tad āśaya anuguṇaiḥ vicitraiḥ śukla dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes endowed with various virtuous qualities such as gratitude and appreciation, which are in accordance with that intention.

original: uttari ca bhūmipariśodhakāni karmāṇi samanveṣamāṇo mahāvīryārambhaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: uttari ca bhūmi pariśodhakāni karmāṇi samanveṣamāṇaḥ mahā vīrya ārambha prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: And seeking the actions that purify the higher stages, he attains great exertion of vigor.

analyzed: tasya tat nidānam āśaya adhyāśaya adhimukti dhātuḥ paripūryate
translated: On that basis, his element of aspiration, superior aspiration, and faith is fulfilled.

analyzed: tad nidānam ca asaṃhāryaḥ bhavati avikampyaḥ sarva tīrthya māra śāsana pratyarthika bhūtaiḥ
translated: And on that basis, he becomes unassailable and unshakable by all the tirthikas, maras, and opponents who are hostile to the teachings.

analyzed: pūrvavat ca buddha darśanam vistareṇa kuśala mūla viśuddhiḥ veditavyā
translated: And as before, the vision of the Buddhas and the purification of the roots of virtue should be understood in detail.

analyzed: tatra ayam viśeṣaḥ
translated: Here is the difference:

analyzed: tat yathā tat eva suvarṇa kuśalena karmakāreṇa alaṃkāra vidhi kṛtam asaṃhāryam bhavati akṛta ābharaṇaiḥ jātarupaiḥ
translated: Just as that same gold, when fashioned into an ornament by a skilled goldsmith, becomes unassailable by unworked gold ornaments.

analyzed: evam asya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśala mūlāni asaṃhāryāṇi bhavanti tad anya bāla vihāra sthitaiḥ bodhisattva kuśala mūlaiḥ
translated: Thus, the roots of goodness of this bodhisattva are not surpassed by the roots of goodness of bodhisattvas dwelling in the other stages of childhood.

analyzed: tat yathā ca maṇi ratna muktā ālokam asaṃhāryam bhavati tad anyaiḥ maṇibhiḥ
translated: Just as the light of a precious jewel is not surpassed by the light of other jewels,

analyzed: sarva vāta udaka vṛṣṭibhiḥ ca an ācchedya prabham bhavati
translated: and it is not interrupted by any wind, water, or rain.

analyzed: evam ayam saṃhāryaḥ bhavati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva is not surpassed by any śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: an ācchedya prajñā ālokaḥ ca bhavati sarva māra pratyarthikaiḥ
translated: and the light of his wisdom is not interrupted by any māras or adversaries.

analyzed: upapattitaḥ ca suyāmaḥ bhavati deva rājaḥ
translated: And by rebirth, he becomes the king of the Suyāma gods.

analyzed: kuśalaḥ sattvānām satkāyadṛṣṭi vinivartana tāyai
translated: He is skilled in turning beings away from the view of the real existence of the body.

original: prabhāve ca yatra pūrvavihāre śatasahasraguṇaṃ samākhyātaṃ tatrāsmin koṭisamākhyātaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: prabhāve ca yatra pūrva vihāre śata sahasraguṇam samākhyātam tatra asmin koṭi samākhyātam veditavyam
translated: And the power that was explained as a hundred thousand times greater in the previous stage should be known here as a billion times greater.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvānām bodhi pakṣya ādhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' stage of superior wisdom that is conducive to enlightenment.

analyzed: dharma āloka praveśa niṣpattim pratilābhataḥ ca jñāna paripācanataḥ ca bodhi pakṣya dharma niṣevaṇataḥ ca
translated: It is the accomplishment of entering the light of the Dharma, the maturation of knowledge, and the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: satkāya dṛṣṭi ādi sarva abhiniveśa iñjita prahāṇataḥ ca pratiṣiddha anujñāta karma vivarjana niṣevaṇataḥ ca
translated: And by abandoning all attachments such as the view of the real existence of the body, and by avoiding prohibited actions and engaging in permitted actions,

analyzed: tad nidānam citta mārdavataḥ ca tad anukūla guṇa samṛddhitaḥ ca
translated: and by the softness of mind that results from that, and by the abundance of qualities that accord with it, one attains the stage of joy.

analyzed: bhūmi pariśodhaka karma paryeṣṭim ārabhya mahā vīrya ārambhataḥ ca tad nidānam āśaya adhyāśaya adhimukti viśodhanataḥ ca
translated: Beginning with the search for the action that purifies the stages, and by the great exertion of effort, and by the purification of intention, superior intention, and faith that results from that,

analyzed: tat nidānam sarva śāsana pratyarthika asaṃhāryataḥ ca kuśala mūla viśuddhitaḥ ca upapattitaḥ ca
translated: and by the indestructibility of all opponents to the teaching that results from that, and by the purification of the roots of goodness, and by rebirth,

analyzed: prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: and by power, it should be known as taught in brief.

original: vistaranirdeśaḥ punastadyathādaśabhūmike 'rciṣmatī bhūminirdeśe bodhipakṣyā dharmāstasyāṃ bhūmau jñānārcibhūtāḥ samyagdharmadeśanā prajñāvabhāsakarakālokānām
analyzed: vistara nirdeśaḥ punar tat yathā daśa bhūmike rciṣmatī bhūmi nirdeśe bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ tasyām bhūmau jñāna arci bhūtāḥ samyak dharma deśanā prajñā avabhāsa karaka ālokānām
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows: In the teaching of the Arciṣmatī stage in the Daśabhūmika, the factors of enlightenment are the flames of knowledge in that stage, the correct teaching of the Dharma, and the light of wisdom for the world.

analyzed: tasmāt sā bhūmiḥ arciṣmatī iti ucyate
translated: Therefore, that stage is called Arciṣmatī (Radiant).

analyzed: sā eva ca iha bodhi pakṣya aprajñā avabhāsa karadhi prajñavihāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: And that very [stage] is called the Abode of Wisdom that Illuminates the Factors of Enlightenment here.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ bodhisattvānām satya pratisaṃyuktaḥ dvitīyaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: What is the second pleasurable state of superior wisdom of the bodhisattvas that is related to the truths?

original: iha bodhisattvaḥ pūrvake 'dhiprajñavihāre yā daśa viśuddhāśayasamatāḥ pratilabdhāḥ tāsāmadhimātrātvāt paripūrṇatvāt dvitīyamadhiprajñavihāraṃ
analyzed: iha bodhisattvaḥ pūrvake dhi prajña vihāre yāḥ daśa viśuddha āśaya samatāḥ pratilabdhāḥ tāsām adhimātrā tvāt paripūrṇa tvāt dvitīyam adhi prajña vihāram
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who has attained the ten equalities of a pure attitude in the previous pleasurable state of superior wisdom, by the greatness and fullness of those,

analyzed: praviśati
translated: enters the second pleasurable state of superior wisdom.

analyzed: daśa viśuddha āśaya samatāḥ yathāsūtram granthataḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: The ten equalities of a pure attitude should be known from the text as they are in the sutra.

analyzed: asamaiḥ ca buddhaiḥ buddhāḥ samāḥ
translated: The buddhas are equal to the unequalled buddhas.

analyzed: tad anya sattvadhātu samatikrāntāḥ
translated: They surpass the realm of other beings.

analyzed: yaiḥ ca dharmaiḥ yathā samāḥ
translated: And they are equal in the way they are equal to those dharmas.

analyzed: iti ayam samāsa arthaḥ viśuddha āśaya samatānām veditavyaḥ
translated: This should be known as the summarized meaning of the equalities of a pure attitude.

analyzed: saḥ smin vihāre vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He, established in this pleasurable state,

original: bhūyo jñānavaiśeṣikatāṃ prārthayamānaḥ catvāryasatyāni daśabhirākārairyathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: bhūyas jñāna vaiśeṣika tām prārthayamānaḥ catvāri asatyāni daśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: desiring further excellence in knowledge, understands the four noble truths as they really are with ten aspects.

analyzed: granthataḥ yathāsūtram eva sarvam veditavyam
translated: Everything should be known from the text as it is in the sutra.

original: parasaṃjñāpanatāṃ pratyātmajñānatāṃ tadubhayādhiṣṭhānatāṃ cārabhya yacca deśyate /
analyzed: para saṃjñāpana tām pratyātma jñāna tām tad ubhaya adhiṣṭhāna tām ca ārabhya yat ca deśyate
translated: It is taught beginning with the teaching of others, personal knowledge, and the basis of both.

analyzed: sūtra vinaya mātṛkām ārabhya yena ca deśyate
translated: Beginning with the sutras, vinaya, and matrka, and by whom it is taught.

original: pratyupannaduḥkhātmakatāṃ hetutaścānāgataduḥkhaprabhāvatāṃ hetukṣayāt tatkṣayānutpādanatāṃ tatprahāṇopāyaniṣevaṇatāṃ cārabhya yathā deśyate
analyzed: pratyupanna duḥkha ātmaka tām hetutaḥ ca anāgata duḥkha prabhāva tām hetu kṣayāt tad kṣaya anutpādana tām tad prahāṇa upāya niṣevaṇa tām ca ārabhya yathā deśyate
translated: Beginning with the nature of present suffering and the power of future suffering from causes, the cessation of that suffering from the cessation of its causes, and the practice of the means of abandoning that suffering, as it is taught.

analyzed: iti ayam samāsa arthaḥ tasya daśa ākārasya catur ārya satya jñānasya veditavyaḥ
translated: This should be known as the concise meaning of those ten aspects of the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: sa evaṃ satyakuśalaḥ sarvañca saṃskāragataṃ prajñayā samyag vidūṣayati /
analyzed: saḥ evam satya kuśalaḥ sarvañca saṃskāra gatam prajñayā samyak vidūṣayati
translated: He, being skilled in the truths, fully destroys with wisdom the entire realm of conditioned things.

analyzed: sattvadhātau ca karūṇa āśayam vivardhayati
translated: And he increases the compassionate intention towards the realm of beings.

analyzed: pūrva anta apara antataḥ ca bāla sattva mithyā pratipattim samyak pratividhyati
translated: And he fully penetrates the false practices of foolish beings in the past and future.

analyzed: teṣām ca vimokṣāya mahā puṇya jñāna sambhāra parigrahe cittam praṇidhatte
translated: And he resolves to take up the great collection of merit and wisdom for their liberation.

analyzed: tad gata āśayam ca samudānayati
translated: And he generates the intention focused on that.

analyzed: smṛti mati gati pramukhaiḥ prabhūtaiḥ vicitraiḥ guṇaiḥ samṛddhaḥ ca
translated: And he is endowed with many varied qualities such as mindfulness, understanding, and realization.

analyzed: anya manasikāra apagataḥ
translated: And he is free from other mental activities.

analyzed: citraiḥ sattvān paripācayati
translated: And he ripens beings through various means of ripening.

original: yāni ca sattvānugrāhakāni laukikāni lipiśāstramudrāgaṇanādīni yathāsūtrameva śilpakarmaṃsthānāni tāni sarvāṇyābhinirharati sattvakaruṇatayā
analyzed: yāni ca sattva anugrāhakāni laukikāni lipi śāstra mudrā gaṇanā ādīni yathāsūtram eva śilpa karmaṃsthānāni tāni sarvāṇi ā abhinirharati sattva karuṇa tayā
translated: And he accomplishes all those worldly crafts and occupations, such as writing, grammar, and mathematics, which are helpful to beings, just as they are described in the sūtras, out of compassion for beings.

original: Dutt anupūrveṇa yāvat bodhipratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ laukikavyavahārānukūlatayā dāridryanāśopāyatayā
analyzed: anupūrveṇa yāvat bodhi pratiṣṭhāpana artham laukika vyavahāra anukūla tayā dāridrya nāśa upāya tayā
translated: In due order, up to the establishment of enlightenment, in accordance with worldly conventions, as a means to destroy poverty,

analyzed: dhātu vaiṣamya manuṣya amanuṣya upasaṃhṛta upadrava praśamana tayā navadya krīḍā rati vastu upasaṃhārataḥ
translated: as a means to alleviate harm caused by imbalances of the elements, humans and non-humans, by providing blameless objects of play and enjoyment,

analyzed: dharma rati vyāvartana tayā sannivāsa upakaraṇa arthinām alpa kṛcchreṇa sannivāsa upakaraṇa upasaṃharaṇa tayā
translated: by turning away from worldly pleasures, by providing the requisites for living together, by providing the requisites for living together with little difficulty,

analyzed: rāja caura ādi upadrava paritrāṇa tayā sthāna asthāna prayoga anujñā pratiṣedhana tayā maṅgalya amaṅgalya vastu ādāna tyāga sanniyojana tayā
translated: by protecting from harm caused by kings, thieves, and so on, by allowing the practice of proper places and prohibiting the practice of improper places, by engaging in accepting and rejecting auspicious and inauspicious things,

analyzed: dṛṣṭe dharme paraspara anabhidroha samparāya aviparīta abhyudaya mārga upadeśana tayā
translated: by teaching the path to prosperity in this life that is free from mutual harm and is not perverted in the next life.

original: ityayaṃ teṣāṃ sattvānugrāhakānāṃ śilpakarmasthānānāṃ samāsārtho veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: iti ayam teṣām sattva anugrāhakānām śilpa karmasthānānām samāsa arthaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Thus, the concise meaning of those crafts and occupations that are helpful to beings should be known.

analyzed: sarvam anyat pūrvavat
translated: All else is as before.

analyzed: tatra ayam viśeṣaḥ
translated: Here is the difference.

original: tadyathā tadeva svarṇakuśalena karmakāreṇa musāragalvamṛṣṭaṃ pratyarpitamatulyatayā 'saṃhāryaṃ bhavati tadanyaiḥ suvarṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā tat eva svarṇa kuśalena karmakāreṇa musāragalva mṛṣṭam pratyarpitam atulya tayā saṃhāryam bhavati tad anyaiḥ suvarṇaiḥ
translated: Just as that very gold, polished by a skillful smith with an ointment of musāragalva, becomes incomparable and cannot be surpassed by any other gold,

original: evamayaṃ bodhisattvo 'saṃhāryo bhavati sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ tadanyabhūmisthitaiśca bodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: evam ayam saṃhāryaḥ bhavati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ tad anya bhūmi sthitaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: in the same way, this bodhisattva becomes incomparable to all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and to bodhisattvas dwelling on other stages.

original: tadyathā candrasūryanakṣatrāṇāmābhā asaṃhāryā ca bhavati sarva vātamaṇḍalaiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā candra sūrya nakṣatrāṇām ābhā asaṃhāryā ca bhavati
translated: And just as the light of the moon, sun, and stars cannot be surpassed by any whirlwind,

analyzed: sarva vāta vāhā sādhāraṇā ca bhavati
translated: and they are common to all whirlwinds,

original: evamevāsya bodhisattvasya sā prajñā asaṃhāryā bhavati sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: evam eva asya bodhisattvasya sā prajñā asaṃhāryā bhavati sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: in the same way, this bodhisattva's wisdom cannot be surpassed by any śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: laukika kriyā sādhāraṇā ca bhavati

analyzed: upapattitaḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ bhavati devarājaḥ
translated: By rebirth, he becomes the king of the Tuṣita gods,

analyzed: kuśalaḥ sarva tīrthya vinivartana tāyai
translated: skilled in turning away all tīrthikas.

analyzed: prabhāvaḥ ca koṭī śata sahasra saṃkhyā nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: And his power should be known as described in the number of hundreds of thousands of koṭis.

analyzed: ayam bodhisattvānām satya pratisaṃyuktaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' abode of higher wisdom connected with the truths.

analyzed: śuddha āśaya samatā niṣpatti praveśataḥ ca upāya satya vyavacāraṇā prativivardhanataḥ ca  sarva saṃskāra vidūṣaṇataḥ ca kārūṇya vivardhanataḥ ca tad artham puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra upacaya praṇidhāna prayogataḥ ca
translated: It is also the entry into the accomplishment of the equality of pure intention, and the non-increase of investigation and discernment of means and truth,🔽the defilement of all formations, the increase of compassion, the application of vows to accumulate the provisions of merit and knowledge for that purpose,

analyzed: smṛti mati gati ādi guṇa vivṛddhitaḥ ca an anya manasikāra sarva ākāra sattva paripācana abhiyogataḥ ca
translated: the increase of qualities such as mindfulness, understanding, and wisdom, the effort to ripen all beings in every way without attending to anything else,

analyzed: laukika śilpa abhinirhārataḥ ca kuśala mūla viśuddhitaḥ ca upapattitaḥ ca prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: the accomplishment of worldly crafts, the purification of wholesome roots, rebirth, and power. It should be known as the brief teaching.

original: vistaranirdeśataḥ punastadyathā daśabhūmike sudurjayāyāṃ bhūmau sattveṣu niścayajñānaṃ sudurjayam /

analyzed: tat ca iha paridīpitam
translated: And that is explained here.

analyzed: tasmāt sā bhumiḥ su durjayā iti ucyate
translated: Therefore, that ground is called Sudurjaya (Difficult to Conquer).

analyzed: tena eva ca arthena satya pratisaṃyuktaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And for that very reason, the abode of superior wisdom connected with the truths should be seen.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ bodhisattvānām pratītyasamutpāda pratisaṃyuktaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' abode of superior wisdom connected with dependent origination?

original: iha bodhisattvena pūrvameva satyapratisaṃyukte adhiprajñavihāre daśa dharmasamatāḥ pratilabdhaḥ Dutt bhavanti /

translated: Here, the bodhisattva has previously attained the ten equalities of dharmas in the stage of higher wisdom connected with the truths.

analyzed: yathāsūtram granthataḥ tāḥ veditavyāḥ

translated: by the equality of non-arising due to the absence of characteristics of that very [inherent nature], by the equality of non-production from causes due to the absence of causes, by the equality of complete primordial peace due to the absence of causes,

translated: Because the nature that is the domain of non-conceptual knowledge is non-dual, like the equality of what is created by magic.

analyzed: iti ayam tāsām daśānām dharma samatānām artha vibhāgaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This should be known as the division of the meaning of those ten equalities of dharmas.

original: so 'sminvihāre sthitaḥ sattveṣu saṃvṛddhakaruṇo bodhau tīvracchandābhilāṣajātaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ smin vihāre sthitaḥ sattveṣu saṃvṛddha karuṇaḥ bodhau tīvra chanda abhilāṣa jātaḥ
translated: He who is established in this abode, with compassion for beings greatly increased, having generated intense desire and longing for enlightenment,

original: lokānāṃ saṃbhavañca vibhavañca sarvākārayā pratītyasamutpādasamyagvyavacāraṇatayā vyavacārayati prajānāti /
analyzed: lokānām saṃbhavam ca vibhavam ca sarvākārayā pratītyasamutpāda samyak vyavacāraṇa tayā vyavacārayati prajānāti
translated: investigates and understands the origin and destruction of the worlds through the correct investigation of dependent origination in all aspects.

analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda jñāna sanniśritam ca asya vimokṣa mukha trayam ājātam bhavati śūnyam animittam apraṇihitam
translated: And for him, based on the knowledge of dependent origination, the three doors of liberation arise: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: tatas nidānam ca asya ātma para kāraka vedaka bhāva abhāva saṃjñāḥ na pravartante
translated: And on that basis, his notions of self, other, agent, experiencer, existence, and non-existence do not occur.

original: sa evaṃ paramārthakuśalaḥ sattvasāpekṣaḥ yoniśaḥ pratividhyati kleśasaṃyogāt /
analyzed: saḥ evam parama artha kuśalaḥ sattva sāpekṣaḥ yoniśas pratividhyati kleśa saṃyogāt
translated: He, being thus skilled in the ultimate truth, concerned for beings, penetrates correctly, due to the connection with afflictions.

original: pratyayasāmagryācca saṃskṛtaṃ prakṛtidurbalamātmātmīyavirahitamanekadoṣaduṣṭaṃ pravartate na vinā kleśasaṃyogapratyayasāmagrīm /
analyzed: pratyaya sāmagryāt ca saṃskṛtam prakṛti durbalam ātma ātmīya virahitam aneka doṣa duṣṭam pravartate na vinā kleśa saṃyoga pratyaya sāmagrīm
translated: And conditioned [phenomena] arise due to the assemblage of conditions, being naturally weak, devoid of self and what belongs to self, and afflicted by many faults, not without the assemblage of conditions connected with afflictions.

original: tena mayā kleśasaṃyogapratyayasāmagrīṃ ca vikalīkartavyā cātmarakṣārtham /
analyzed: tena mayā kleśa saṃyoga pratyaya sāmagrīm ca vikalīkartavyā ca ātma rakṣā artham
translated: Therefore, for the sake of protecting oneself, that assemblage of conditions connected with afflictions should be impaired.

original: na ca sarveṇa sarvaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ vyupaśamayitavyaṃ sattvānugrahārtham /
analyzed: na ca sarveṇa sarvam saṃskṛtam vyupaśamayitavyam sattva anugraha artham
translated: And conditioned [phenomena] should not be completely pacified, for the sake of benefiting beings.

original: tasyaivaṃ jñānakārūṇyānugatasyāsmin vihāre 'saṅgajñānābhimukho nāma prajñāpāramitāvihāraḥ abhisaṃmukhī bhavati /
analyzed: tasya evam jñāna kārūṇya anugatasya asmin vihāre saṅga jñāna abhimukhaḥ nāma prajñāpāramitā vihāraḥ abhisaṃmukhī bhavati
translated: For one who is thus endowed with knowledge and compassion, in this stage, the abode of the perfection of wisdom called facing unobstructed knowledge becomes manifest.

analyzed: yena ayam sarva lokika caryāsu aśaktaḥ carati
translated: By which one moves freely in all worldly conduct.

original: sa ca vihāro yā tīkṣṇā saptamyāṃ bhūmau prāyogikacaryāparyantagatā bodhisattvakṣāntiḥ tayānulomikyā kṣāntyā saṃgṛhīto veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca vihāraḥ yā tīkṣṇā saptamyām bhūmau prāyogika caryā paryanta gatā bodhisattva kṣāntiḥ tayā ānulomikyā kṣāntyā saṃgṛhītaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: And that abode should be understood as being included by that concordant acceptance of the bodhisattvas, which is sharp and reaches the end of practice in the seventh stage.

analyzed: saḥ saṅga jñāna abhimukha prajñāpāramitā vihāra ābhimukhyāt bodhi āhārakān ca pratyayān āharati
translated: He attracts the conditions that nourish enlightenment by facing the abode of the perfection of wisdom called facing unobstructed knowledge.

analyzed: laukikānām ca saṃskṛta saṃvāse na saṃvasati
translated: And he does not associate with the worldly enjoyment of conditioned [phenomena].

analyzed: praśame ca śānta darśī bhavati
translated: And he is one who sees peace in tranquility.

analyzed: na ca tatra avatiṣṭhate
translated: But he does not remain there.

analyzed: tasya evam upāya prajñā jñāna anugatasya avatāra śūnyatā samādhi pramukhāni daśa samādhi mukha śata sahasrāṇi āmukhī bhavati
translated: For him, who is thus endowed with the knowledge of means and wisdom, one hundred thousand doors of concentration such as the concentration of the emptiness of engagement, etc., become manifest.

analyzed: yathā śūnyatā samādhiḥ evam apraṇihita animitta samādhayaḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Just as the concentration of emptiness, so should the concentration of wishlessness and signlessness be understood.

analyzed: teṣām āmukhībhavāt abhedya āśayaḥ ca bhavati
translated: By their manifestation, he becomes one of unshakable resolve.

analyzed: sarva ākārāt śāsanāt asaṃhāryaḥ ca bhavati sarva māra tīrthya śāsana pratyarthikaiḥ śeṣam pūrvavat
translated: And he becomes unassailable by all demons, tīrthikas, and opponents of the teachings. The rest is as before.

original: tatrāyaṃ viśeṣaḥ /🔽tadyathā tadeva suvarṇaṃ kuśalena karmakāreṇa vaidūryamaṇiratnamuṣṭaṃ pratyarpitamasaṃhāryaṃ
analyzed: tatra ayam viśeṣaḥ  tat yathā tat eva suvarṇam kuśalena karmakāreṇa vaidūrya maṇi ratna muṣṭam pratyarpitam asaṃhāryam
translated: Here is the difference:🔽Just as that same gold, when polished by a skillful smith into a jewel ornament on the body of a universal monarch, becomes unassailable by other gold ornaments,

original: bhavati tadanyaiḥ sarvajātarūpaiḥ evamasya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśalamūlāni viśuddhatarāṇi
analyzed: bhavati tad anyaiḥ sarva jātarūpaiḥ evam asya bodhisattvasya tāni kuśala mūlāni viśuddhatarāṇi
translated: in the same way, his wholesome roots become even more purified

analyzed: bhavanti asaṃhāryāṇi pūrvavat
translated: and unassailable by others, as before.

original: tadyathā candraprabhā sattvāśrayāṃśca prahalādayatyanācchedyaprabhā ca bhavati catasṛbhirvātamaṇḍalikābhiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā candra prabhā sattva āśrayān ca prahalādayati anācchedya prabhā ca bhavati catasṛbhiḥ vātamaṇḍalikābhiḥ
translated: For example, the light of the moon delights the bodies of beings and is an uninterrupted light, not overcome by the four great wind-circles.

original: evamasya bodhisattvasya sā prajñābhā sarvasattvakleśaparidāhañca praśamayati /
analyzed: evam asya bodhisattvasya sā prajñā ābhā sarva sattva kleśa paridāhan ca praśamayati
translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva's light of wisdom pacifies the burning of all beings' afflictions.

analyzed: an ācchedyā ca bhavati sarva māra pratyarthikaiḥ
translated: And it is uninterrupted by all demons and adversaries.

analyzed: sunirmitaḥ ca bhavati devarājaḥ
translated: And he becomes a very well-fashioned king of gods.

analyzed: kuśalaḥ sattvānām sarva abhimāna vinivartana tāyai
translated: Skilled in turning away all pride of beings.

analyzed: prabhāvaḥ pi koṭī śata sahasram saṃkhyā nirdeśataḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The power should be seen as a hundred thousand times greater in number.

analyzed: ayam pratītyasamutpāda pratisaṃyuktaḥ dhi prajña vihāraḥ
translated: This is the superior wisdom abode connected with dependent origination.

analyzed: dharma samatā pariniṣpatti praveśataḥ ca pratītyasamutpāda avabodha vimokṣa mukha sambhavataḥ ca
translated: From the attainment of the equality of phenomena, from the realization of dependent origination, from the door of liberation, from the arising,

analyzed: sarva mithyā saṃjñā samudācārataḥ ca upāya saṃsāra parigrahataḥ ca asaṅga jñāna abhimukha prajñāpāramitā vihāra abhimukhataḥ ca
translated: from the non-occurrence of all false perceptions, from the acceptance of the world through skillful means, from the unobstructed knowledge, from the face-to-face presence of the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: a pramāṇa samādhi pratilambhataḥ ca abhedya āśaya pratilambhataḥ ca śāsanāt a saṃhāryataḥ ca
translated: And through the attainment of the concentration of the immeasurables, through the attainment of an indestructible intention, and through being unmoved by the teachings.

analyzed: kuśala mūla viśuddhitaḥ upapattitaḥ prabhāvataḥ ca samāsa nirdeśataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: It should be known as the brief teaching of the purification of the roots of virtue through rebirth and power.

analyzed: vistara nirdaśataḥ tat yathā bhimukhyām bhūmau
translated: The detailed explanation is like in the Abhimukhi stage.

analyzed: asaṅga jñāna abhimukhasya prajñāpāramitā vihārasya ābhimukhyāt abhimukhī iti ucyate
translated: The abode of the perfection of wisdom, which is directed towards unattached knowledge, is called Abhimukhi because it is directed towards it.

analyzed: tanā eva arthena ayam vihāraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This abode should be understood in the same sense.

original: tatra katamo bodhisattvānāṃ sābhisaṃskāraḥ sābhogo nirnimitto vihāraḥ /
analyzed: tatra katamaḥ bodhisattvānām sa abhisaṃskāraḥ sa ābhogaḥ nirnimittaḥ vihāraḥ
translated: Among them, what is the bodhisattvas' abode without signs, with effort and with enjoyment?

original: iha bodhisattvenānantare 'dhiprajñavihāre daśopāyena prajñayā cābhinirhṛtāḥ sarvasattvāsādhāraṇā laukikāḥ sarvalokāsādhāraṇāśca mārgāntarārambhaviśeṣāḥ 🔽pratilabdhā bhavanti /
analyzed: iha bodhisattvena anantare dhi prajña vihāre daśa upāyena prajñayā ca abhinirhṛtāḥ sarva sattva asādhāraṇāḥ laukikāḥ sarva loka asādhāraṇāḥ ca mārga antara ārambha viśeṣāḥ  pratilabdhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Here, the bodhisattva has attained through skillful means and wisdom the ten special paths of action that are not shared by ordinary beings and are not shared by the world, which are produced by superior wisdom in the immediately preceding abode.

analyzed: yeṣām adhimātra tvāt paripūrṇa tvāt saptamam vihāram anupraviśati
translated: By the greatness and fullness of which he enters the seventh abode.

analyzed: teṣām yathāsūtram eva grantha vistaraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Their text should be known as in the sutra itself.

analyzed: laukika sampatti saṃvartakam puṇya parigraham ārabhya sattveṣu hita sukha āśayam ārabhya
translated: Beginning with the acceptance of merit that leads to worldly prosperity, beginning with the benevolent and happy intention towards beings,

analyzed: bodhāya puṇya sambhāra bodhi pakṣya dharma uttara utkarṣam ārabhya śrāvaka a sādhāraṇa tām ārabhya
translated: beginning with the increase of the collection of merit for enlightenment and the factors of enlightenment, beginning with the uncommonness of the śrāvakas,

analyzed: pratyekabuddha asādhāraṇa tām ārabhya sattva dharmadhātum ārabhya lokadhātum ārabhya tathāgata kāya vāc citta jñānam āramya
translated: beginning with the uncommonness of the pratyekabuddhas, beginning with the realm of beings, beginning with the realm of the world, beginning with the knowledge of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: teṣām upāya prajñā abhinihṛtānām mārga antarāṇām ārambha viśeṣāṇām adhikāra arthaḥ samāsatas veditavyaḥ
translated: Thus, the meaning of the occasion of these special undertakings of the intermediate paths that are accomplished by means of skillful means and wisdom should be known in brief.

analyzed: saḥ ebhiḥ yuktaḥ pramāṇam asaṃkhyeyam tathāgata viṣayam pratividhyati  tad samutthānāya
translated: Endowed with these, he penetrates the immeasurable and innumerable domain of the Tathāgatas.

original: cānābhoganirnimittākalpāvikalpanatayā 'pramāṇabuddhiviṣayasamutthānaṃ paśyan nirantaraṃ niścchidraṃ prayujyate sarveryāpathacāravihāramanasikāreṣu
analyzed: ca an ābhoga nirnimitta a kalpa a vikalpana tayā pramāṇa buddhi viṣaya samutthānam paśyan nirantaram niśchidram prayujyate sarva īryāpatha cāra vihāra manasikāreṣu
translated: For the arising of that, he is diligent in the arising of the immeasurable domain of cognition, seeing the arising of the path that is free from effort, signless, and non-conceptual. He practices continuously and uninterruptedly in all modes of conduct, activities, and mental attentions.

analyzed: na asya sarva avasthāgatasya mārga viprayuktaḥ bhavati
translated: For him, who is in all states, the path is not separated.

original: tasya cittakṣaṇe daśapāramitāḥ pramukhāḥ sarve bodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ paripūryante viśeṣeṇa /
analyzed: tasya citta kṣaṇe daśa pāramitāḥ pramukhāḥ sarve bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ paripūryante viśeṣeṇa
translated: And in that moment of his mind, all the factors of enlightenment, with the ten perfections as the main ones, are fulfilled in a special way.

analyzed: anyeṣu tu vihāreṣu na tathā
translated: But not so in the other abodes.

analyzed: prathame pramudita vihāre praṇidhāna adhyālambana tayā dvitīye citta dauḥśīlya mala apakarṣaṇa tayā
translated: In the first abode of great joy, by the support of vows. In the second, by the removal of the stain of immorality in the mind.

analyzed: tṛtīye praṇidhāna vivardhana dharma āloka pratilābha tayā caturthe mārga avatāraṇa tayā pañcabhe
translated: In the third, by the increase of vows and the attainment of the light of the Dharma. In the fourth, by the entry into the path. In the fifth,

analyzed: yā ṣaṣṭhe gambhīra praveśana tayā
translated: by the entry into worldly activities. In the sixth, by the penetration of the profound.

original: āsmin punaḥ saptame vihāre sarvabuddhadharmasamutthāpanatayā bodhaṅgāni paripūryante
analyzed: ā asmin punar saptame vihāre sarva buddha dharma samutthāpana tayā bodhaṅgāni paripūryante
translated: But in this seventh abode, the factors of enlightenment are fulfilled by the generation of all the qualities of the Buddhas.

analyzed: bodhisattva prāyogika caryā paripūri saṃgrahāt asya vihārasya jñāna abhijñā caryā viśuddha aṣṭama vihāra ākramaṇāt ca
translated: Because this abode includes the fulfillment of the practices of the bodhisattva, and because it leads to the entry into the eighth abode, which is the abode of purity in knowledge, supernormal power, and practice.

original: tathā hi sa bodhisattvo 'sya vihārasyānantaramaṣṭamaṃ viśuddhaṃ vihāraṃ praviśati /
analyzed: tathā hi sa bodhisattvaḥ sya vihārasya anantaram aṣṭamam viśuddham vihāram praviśati
translated: For thus that bodhisattva, immediately after this abode, enters the eighth abode, which is pure.

analyzed: sa ca vihāraḥ ekānta viśuddhaḥ
translated: And that abode is completely pure.

analyzed: ime tu sapta vihārāḥ vyāmiśrāḥ
translated: But these seven abodes are mixed.

analyzed: viśuddha vihāra pūrvaṅgama tvāt asaṃkliṣṭaḥ
translated: It is uncontaminated because it precedes the pure abodes.

analyzed: tad asaṃprāpta tvāt saṃkliṣṭa caya patitāḥ vaktavyāḥ
translated: Since it has not yet attained those, it should be said to be contaminated, falling into the accumulation of contamination.

original: tasmādasmin vihāre sarve rāgādipramukhāḥ kleśāḥ prahīyante /
analyzed: tasmāt asmin vihāre sarve rāga ādi pramukhāḥ kleśāḥ prahīyante
translated: Therefore, in this abode, all afflictions led by passion and so on are abandoned.

original: sa ca na saṃkleśo na niḥkleśo veditavyaḥ asamudācārād buddhajñānābhilāṣācca /
analyzed: sa ca na saṃkleśaḥ na niḥkleśaḥ veditavyaḥ a samudācārāt buddha jñāna abhilāṣāt ca
